body.p:
Burksville Ky
July 15th 1865
Gov Tho, E, Bramlette
Dear Sir

My son Asa Myself write you a letter Some time since in Regard to a fine against Asa as Bail for a Negro Boy named Jack who had been arrested upon charge of Burning Barns. (Sd Slaves has since the time he gave bond & before the trial) Joined the federal Service at Lebanon Ky. I have no doubt of the Boy innocence but Asa is in a bad fix and, if you will assist him in this matter by Remitting the fine as So much as is in your power, I will be under Many obligations to you.

Cumberland Cir Ct
vs.
Robt Asa Elliott
$250,
Forfeiture
21st Sept/65
